name: title_genres_plot
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with comparing three lists of movies. For each movie, you are given its: title, genres, plot
    Use your own judgment to determine what information is relevant when assessing the diversity of the lists. 
    You should consider the given title, genres, plot.

    Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison, and choice of the most diverse list in the following JSON format:

    {
        "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list A
        "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list B
        "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list C
        "comparison": string,                    # Compare the diversity of the lists.
        "most_diverse_list_reasoning": string,   # Explanation of which list you perceive to be the most diverse.
        "most_diverse_list": string              # The list you determine to be the most diverse, either 'A', 'B', or 'C'.
    }

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)
GENRES: Action, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

TITLE: Snatch (2000)
GENRES: Comedy, Crime
PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

TITLE: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)
GENRES: Action, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.

TITLE: Jurassic Park (1993)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Thriller
PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Comedy, Sci-Fi
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Others, The (2001)
GENRES: Horror, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

TITLE: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
GENRES: Biography, Drama
PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

TITLE: The Hunger Games (2012)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Thriller
PLOT: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety of genres, including action, mystery, thriller, sci-fi, comedy, horror, biography, and drama.  There's a mix of action-oriented films and more character-driven dramas. However, several films fall under the action/thriller umbrella.
response.list_B_description: List B offers a more balanced representation of genres. It includes action, sci-fi, biography, crime, drama, comedy, family, and war films. The selection is more diverse in terms of tone and subject matter compared to List A.
response.list_C_description: List C has a similar genre spread to List A, with a focus on action, thriller, sci-fi, and drama.  The inclusion of a horror film and a family-oriented comedy adds some diversity, but the overall feel is less varied than List B.
response.comparison: List B stands out due to its broader range of genres and film styles. List A and List C both lean heavily on action and thriller genres, with less diversity in tone and subject matter. List B successfully incorporates comedies, dramas, and even a war film, creating a more eclectic collection.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List B demonstrates the greatest diversity because it encompasses a wider array of genres and film styles.  It includes comedies, dramas, action films, sci-fi, and even a war film, offering a more varied viewing experience than the other two lists. Lists A and C, while containing some variety, are more focused on action and thriller subgenres.

response.comparison: All three lists contain some overlap in titles (Saving Private Ryan, Fight Club, Ex Machina, Goodfellas) and share similar genre distributions. response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List C demonstrates the greatest diversity because it includes a wider variety of genres and thematic elements compared to Lists A and B. response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres including Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Drama, Family, Fantasy, Mystery, Thriller, Action, Sci-Fi, Crime, Horror, and Biography.  The plots also vary significantly, from emotional journeys (Inside Out, Shawshank Redemption) to thrillers (Shutter Island, Split) and Sci-Fi (The Matrix).  There's a good mix of tones and styles.
response.list_B_description: List B has a nice balance of genres, including Action, Adventure, Fantasy, Sci-Fi, Comedy, Drama, Family, War, and Biography.  However, it has some overlap with List A (Shawshank Redemption). The plots are diverse, ranging from Sci-Fi adventures (Avatar, WALL-E) to character-driven dramas (Little Miss Sunshine, A Beautiful Mind) and war films (1917).
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of genres similar to Lists A and B, featuring Action, Adventure, Fantasy, Sci-Fi, Comedy, Drama, Biography, Mystery, Thriller, War, and Crime. The plots are varied, encompassing Sci-Fi adventures, character studies, mysteries, and thrillers.
response.comparison: All three lists exhibit considerable diversity in genres and plots. List A stands out with its inclusion of animation and a wider variety of subgenres within drama and thriller. List B offers a good balance but shares a movie with List A. List C also shows strong diversity and includes some unique titles not present in the other lists, offering a different perspective.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: While all three lists are diverse, List C edges out the others due to its unique combination of genres and plots.  It successfully incorporates elements from the other lists while also adding movies that offer fresh perspectives and genres not heavily represented in Lists A and B. The inclusion of Knives Out and Gravity significantly contributes to its overall diversity.

response.comparison: All three lists exhibit a fair degree of diversity in terms of genre and plot. List A and B share several movies, leading to some overlap in genre representation. response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List C demonstrates the most diversity because it has a broader range of genres and film styles.
